newsitem.title: EGYPT: Suez Cement 96 profits up, dividend down.
newsitem.headline: Suez Cement 96 profits up, dividend down.

text.p: Suez Cement said on Saturday it made net profits of 297.294 million pounds ($87.58 million) in 1996, 1.2 percent up on 293.700 million in 1995.
The company board is proposing to distribute 220.5 million pounds of the profits to shareholders through a 4.50 pound dividend to each of the 49 million shares.
For 1995, the company distributed 254.800 million pounds to shareholders through an annual dividend of 5.20 pounds.

"This (the 1996 dividend) is in line with the net attributable profit after the company's profits became fully liable to tax in view of the expiration of the tax exemption at the end of 1995," the company said.

The extent of the tax liability was not clear from the figures but the company set aside 57.146 million pounds in provisions for disputes and claims, compared with only 13.060 million for the same purpose in 1995.
The company said it produced 2.879 million tonnes of cement in 1996, compared with 2.867 million in 1995.
